description:
Mocking is a valuable technique for writing tests, but is it always a
good idea?

I want to give a brief introduction to the how and why of mocking and
the scope of its usefulness - I'll look at situations where it is
provides the most benefit and the times when it can be taken too far.

Python is packaged with an excellent mocking module but we'll also look
at some other libraries which can help with mocking effectively.
title: Managing mocks - the how why and when of mocking in Python
